qas.question: What type of law is still in practice in which heresy results in execution?
What author was declared a heretic and had a bounty placed on his head by the government of Iran?
What did Salman Rushdie say was heretical?
What is only punisable by death where Sharia law is practiced?
What country declare Sharia law in 1989?

context: In some modern day nations and regions in which <a0_0><b2_0>Sharia law<b2_0/><a0_0/> is ostensibly practiced, <b3_0>heresy<b3_0/> remains an offense punishable by death. One example is the 1989 fatwa issued by the government of <b4_0>Iran<b4_0/>, offering a substantial bounty for anyone who succeeds in the assassination of author <a1_0>Salman Rushdie<a1_0/>, whose writings were declared as heretical.
